respStmt.resp: Transcribed from images of original letters
respStmt.name: Sarah Tew
Giuliano Sidro
Millie You
Maddie Qualls

publicationStmt.distributor: The Center for the Tebtunis Papyri, The University of California, Berkeley
publicationStmt.authority: The Board of Trinity College Dublin, The University of Dublin

availability.p: Available for academic research purposes only.

objectDesc.p: Handwritten letter of 4 pages on one folded sheet with writing on front and back.
Catalog number '81' written in pencil. A previous number appears to have been erased and overwritten with "77".

recordHist.p: Images taken from Trinity College, Dublin: Page 1Pages 2-3Page 4

projectDesc.p: This document was created as part of the History of Papyrology project [https://histpap.info/] by Sarah Tew, Giuliano Sidro, Maddie Qualls, and Millie You. The project is in affiliation the Center for Tebtunis Papyri at the University of California, Berkeley.

editorialDecl.p: Text has been transcribed diplomatically without corrections, normalization, or standardization.

punctuation.p: All punction marks have been retained nd represented using the appropriate Unicode code character except for apostrophes and ampersands which have been escaped using ' and &, respectively.

segmentation.p: The text has been segmented into lines according to line breaks in the original text automatically by Transkribus and line groupings based on groups identified automatically or manually declared by Sarah Tew in Transkribus. Page breaks have been manually edited by Sarah Tew, Giuliano Sidro, Maddie Qualls, and Millie You after export from Transkribus.

handNotes.handNote: Written in black ink by B.P. Grenfell.

revisionDesc.change: Manually added TEI header to Transkribus tei.xml exported file.

body.ab:
My dear Smyly,
I shall be delighted to see
you. Come when you like. The state
of affairs is this. College is (practically)
closed ) till the 11th , so if you come this
week you will have to put up with
such hospitality as our little house
affords. Blass & two daughters are
coming on the 12th for 4 or 5 days to
stay with us. Hunt is at Romford

but comes up on Sat. ^ or Monday. He has got
the Greek papyri which we bought, i.e.
sundry Roman documents, 2 or 3 Ptolemaic
& a variety of literary & theological fragments.
The papyri we found in our excavation
(about 3 or 4 hundred documents
1-3 cent A.D., with a few late
Ptolemaic & some literary scraps) are
on their way home & will arrive
about May. So just at present there
isnt anything new to show you.

We had a very successful season on
the whole though we had very hard
luck in one respect. We found a
large cemetery of papyrus mummies like
the Gurob ones, but damp &
imperfect mummification had reduced
the papyri to powder !
I was very glad to see Mahaffy's
preliminary blast in the Athenaeum
about the new ed. of the P.P.
Wilcken dug at Ahhnes but

au revoir
yours very sincerely
Bernard P. Grenfell.

P.S. I am dining out on Sat. evening
but otherwise have no engagements till
the Blasses come.
